thread.title: 5 Rutgers things to know Monday as Kyle Flood returns: Is Indiana game a must-win?
thread.title_full: 5 Rutgers things to know Monday as Kyle Flood returns: Is Indiana game a must-win? | NJ.com

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 5 Rutgers things to know Monday as Kyle Flood returns: Is Indiana game a must-win?
text:
Once Rutgers lost to Washington State and Penn State in consecutive weeks last month, its margin for error in the quest to reach a bowl game for 10th time in 11 seasons became slim.
Now, at 2-3 heading into this Saturday's clash at Indiana, the Scarlet Knights figure to need to win and beat a team they're not supposed to in order to reach the 6-win plateau.
While Indiana is only two weeks removed from pushing top-ranked Ohio State to near upset, the Hoosiers have dropped two straight and there are questions to begin the week about whether they will have the services of their quarterback (Nate Sudfeld) or leading rusher (Jordan Howard).
It's why late Sunday night the Vegas sportsbooks apparently were holding off posting a betting line, although Indiana figures to be the favorite when it hosts Rutgers for a 3:30 p.m. clash Saturday in Bloomington, Ind.
Regardless of whether the Scarlet Knights are labeled the underdog, the Indiana game figures to be a must-win if they have any chance of continuing their streak of four straight years with a bowl trip.
Following the Indiana game is a home date with No. 1 Ohio State (6-0), a trip to face previously ranked Wisconsin (4-2) and a trip to play No. 12 Michigan (5-1 following three straight shutout wins). Rutgers figures to be a heavy underdog in all three of those games.
A Nov. 14 home date versus Nebraska (2-4) looks more winnable than it did before the season, although the Cornerhuskers — who have lost all four of their games on the opponent's final offensive play — may be the best four-loss team in the country.
A loss to Indiana this week and Rutgers faces the likelihood of being eliminated from bowl contention before it even hosts Nebraska in mid-November. Defeat Indiana and the final three-game stretch — home versus Nebraska, at Army (1-5) and home versus Maryland (2-4) — will have meaning regardless of how ugly Ohio State, Wisconsin and Michigan turn out to be.
Here are five stories from Sunday to get you up to speed on the latest Rutgers football news:
Rutgers AD Julie Hermann on Norries Wilson: 'Truly we're lucky he was here to step in' Blame Kyle Flood for Rutgers' fourth-down spike snafu | Politi 10 takeaways from Rutgers' loss to Michigan State Michigan State coach Mark Dantonio: Don't be 'too hard' on Rutgers quarterback Chris Laviano What happened to Rutgers running back Paul James after his 72-yard run?
